column2: What is the minimum grade for earning graduate credit?
column3: The University of New Hampshire requires a minimum of three hours of student academic work each week. For each credit hour, the University requires, at least six but no more than 10 thesis credits. Students are advised to review their program's degree requirements as the exact number of thesis credit that are required for each degree will be determined by the faculty of the individual programs.

column2: How many thesis credits are required for a master’s thesis and how are they graded?
column3: Students are not eligible to receive credit for any more than the maximum number of thesis credits required by the degree and are expected to monitor their registration to ensure that they do not exceed the minimum. The policy can be found in the annual publication of the Student Rights, Rules, and Responsibilities.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Thesis - Thesis Credit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Students%20are%20not%20eligible%20to%20receive%20credit%20for%20any%20more%20than%20the%20maximum%20number%20of%20thesis%20credits%20required%20by%20the%20degree%20and%20are%20expected%20to%20monitor%20their)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Credit Hour Policy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=For%20each%20credit%20hour%2C%20the%20University%20requires%2C%20at%20a%20minimum%2C%20the%20equivalent%20of%20three%20hours%20of%20student%20academic%20work%20each%20week%20assuming%20a%2015-week%20semester)", "- Academic Integrity - Academic Integrity (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-integrity/#:~:text=The%20members%20of%20its%20academic%20community%20both%20require%20and%20expect%20one%20another%20to%20conduct%20themselves%20with%20integrity.)"]

column2: What is the time limit to complete a master’s degree?
column3: All graduate work for any master's degree must normally be completed within four years from the date of matriculation (enrollment following admission) in the program.

column2: What are the residency requirements for the Ph.D.?
column3: The Ph.D. is required to complete a capstone experience by the end of the final examination period of graduation date for which the degree is to be conferred.

column2: What is Doctoral Research (999) and when must Ph.D. students register for it?
column3: Ph.D. students at candidacy must register for Doctoral Research (999) each semester during the academic year until the degree is awarded.

column2: When is a Ph.D. student advanced to candidacy and what form is required?
column3: A Ph.D. student is advanced to candidacy for the degree by the dean of the Graduate School after the student has passed the qualifying examination, met the language or proficiency requirements as are deemed desirable by their program, declared a topic for dissertation research, and fully formed their doctoral dissertation committee.

column2: What are the Ph.D. time limits at UNH?
column3: The University of New Hampshire is in compliance with the federal definition of credit hour. Students are required to cooperate to the fullest extent with students from communities scheduling elections at other times. Student work reflects intended learning outcomes and is verified through evidence of student achievement.

column2: What does an AU grade mean?

column2: What does an IA grade indicate?
column3: IA grade indicates incomplete in thesis credit, doctoral research, or other continuing courses of more than one semester. The grade earned will replace the "IA" once the work has been completed and the final term of enrollment will be assigned a "CR".
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Failure%20to%20officially%20withdraw%20will%20result%20in%20an%20AF%20grade%2C%20which%20is%20maintained%20on%20the%20official%20student%20record%20and%20included%20in%20the%20grade%20point%20average%20%28GPA%29.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Incomplete%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22IC%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20with%20the%20approval%20of%20the%20instructor%20for%20excused%20unfinished%20work%20only.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=The%20process%20by%20which%20a%20student%20can%20be%20dismissed%20from%20an%20academic%20program%20for%20violations%20of%20academic%20standards%20or%20violations%20of%20professional%2C%20ethical%2C%20and/or)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20grade%20earned%20will%20replace%20the%20%22IA%22%20once%20the%20work%20has%20been%20completed.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: What is the policy on course withdrawal (W) and its impact?
column3: Students who submit an approved petition to drop a course during the withdrawal period will receive an AF grade, which is maintained on the official student record and included in the grade point average (GPA). Not attending classes does not constitute an automatic withdrawal.

column2: What happens when a graduate course is repeated?
column3: If the course numbers and/or titles do not match exactly, graduate students must obtain written permission of their adviser, graduated program coordinator, and the endorsement of the Graduate School dean before the adjustment will be made. A course may only be repeated once. Only repeated courses taken at UNH will alter the cumulative grade-­point average.

column2: How long do I have to complete my master’s degree?

column2: What is the application deadline?
column3: Incomplete Applications: Applications that remain incomplete after the deadline for a program has passed, or before the first day of classes of the term for which admission was desired, will be placed in an inactive status. A written request is required to reactivate an application.

column2: Can I defer my admission?
column3: Applicants who cannot enroll in the term for which admission was offered may request to have their admission deferred for up to one year. Such requests must be in writing and will be considered only once. Because enrollments are limited and competition for admission may vary from year to year, such requests may not be granted.

column2: What is the minimum grade for earning graduate credit?
column3: The University of New Hampshire requires a minimum of three hours of student academic work each week. For each credit hour, the University requires, at least six but no more than 10 thesis credits. Students are advised to review their program's degree requirements as the exact number of thesis credit that are required for each degree will be determined by the faculty of the individual programs.

column2: Does UNH offer student health insurance?
column3: The University of New Hampshire (UNH) is a land-grant institution that is responsible for the ethical and safe conduct of research and scholarly activity. As an institution of higher education that prides itself on extensive research endeavors and the involvement of undergraduate students and graduate students in research projects, UNH has an obligation to teach and actively promote integrity in Research and Scholarship.

column2: How many credits can I take?
column3: Credit Transfer: A maximum of 12 credits taken by a student prior to matriculation (internal and external combined) can be applied to the degree program. The exact number of thesis credits that are required for each degree will be determined by the faculty of the individual programs. Student work reflects intended learning outcomes and is verified through evidence of student achievement. Credit Hour Policy: The University of New Hampshire is in compliance with the federal definition of credit hour.

column2: Can I change my degree?
column3: Applicants who can not enroll in the term for which admission was offered may request to have their admission deferred for up to one year. Students who request a Deferral, and who are not currently active in another degree program, are responsible for dropping any courses they may be currently enrolled in at the time they request the Delugeral. Such requests must be in writing and will be considered only once. Because enrollments are limited and competition for admission may vary from year to year, such requests may not be granted.

column2: What are the Ph.D. time limits at UNH?
column3: The University of New Hampshire is in compliance with the federal definition of credit hour. column2: Who supervises the Capstone Experience in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The most appropriate capstone experience is determined by the faculty of each program. Such experiences may include a single integrative course, performance, an internship or praxis, portfolio, scholarly paper or essay, examination, research problem, project, or thesis, and are subject to approval of the dean in the Graduate School. column2: What is the policy on course withdrawal (W) and its impact?
column3: Students who submit an approved petition to drop a course during the withdrawal period will receive an AF grade, which is maintained on the official student record and included in the grade point average (GPA). Not attending classes does not constitute an automatic withdrawal.

column2: What happens when a graduate course is repeated?
column3: If the course numbers and/or titles do not match exactly, graduate students must obtain written permission of their adviser, graduated program coordinator, and the endorsement of the Graduate School dean before the adjustment will be made. A course may only be repeated once. Only repeated courses taken at UNH will alter the cumulative grade-­point average.

column2: Can I change my degree?
column3: Applicants who can not enroll in the term for which admission was offered may request to have their admission deferred for up to one year. Students who request a Deferral, and who are not currently active in another degree program, are responsible for dropping any courses they may be currently enrolled in at the time they request the Delugeral. Such requests must be in writing and will be considered only once. Because enrollments are limited and competition for admission may vary from year to year, such requests may not be granted.

column2: What is the minimum grade for earning graduate credit?
column3: The University of New Hampshire requires at least three hours of student academic work each week assuming a 15-week semester (student workload for shorter length terms must be increased proportionally per week to maintain required approximately 45 hours per credit per term). Students are not eligible to receive credit for any more than the maximum number of thesis credits required by the degree and are expected to monitor their registration to ensure that they do not exceed the minimum.

column2: Can 700-level courses count for graduate credit?
column3: The University of New Hampshire is in compliance with the federal definition of credit hour. For each credit hours, the University requires, at a minimum, three hours of student academic work each week assuming an 15-week semester (student workload for shorter length terms must be increased proportionally per week to maintain required approximately 45 hours per credit per term). Students are not eligible to receive credit for any more than the maximum number of thesis credits required by the degree and are expected to monitor their registration to ensure that they do not exceed the minimum.

column3: The University of New Hampshire requires at least three hours of student academic work each week assuming a 15-week semester (student workload for shorter length terms must be increased proportionally per week to maintain required approximately 45 hours per credit per term). column2: Can graduate students take courses pass/fail?
column3: Graduate students are required to complete a dissertation defense by the doctoral committee. The final oral examination is conducted by an external committee and is intended to give the candidate an opportunity to defend the dissertation. While it is desirable for all committee members to participate in dissertation defences, whether in person or through virtual means such as conference calls or video conferencing, outside scholars are not necessary to be present at the defense. Departments will determine how to obtain meaningful and substantive evaluations from external members in consultation with the Graduate School. A written final examination, on subject matter not covered in the qualifying exam, may also be required. This written examination

column2: What is the policy on course withdrawal (W) and its impact?
column3: Students who submit an approved petition to drop a course during the withdrawal period will receive an AF grade, which is maintained on the official student record and included in the grade point average (GPA). Not attending classes does not constitute an automatic withdrawal.

column2: What happens when a graduate course is repeated?
column3: If the course numbers and/or titles do not match exactly, graduate students must obtain written permission of their adviser, graduated program coordinator, and the endorsement of the Graduate School dean before the adjustment will be made. A course may only be repeated once. Only repeated courses taken at UNH will alter the cumulative grade-­point average.

While it is desirable for all committee members to participate in dissertation defenses, whether in person or through virtual means such as conference calls or video conferencing, outside scholars are not required. Departments will determine how to obtain meaningful and substantive evaluations from external members in consultation with the Graduate School. column2: How many thesis credits are required in the Information Technology (M.S.) Thesis Option?
column3: Students are not eligible to receive credit for any more than the maximum number of thesis credits required by the degree and are expected to monitor their registration to ensure that they do not exceed the minimum. The policy can be found in the annual publication of the Student Rights, Rules, and Responsibilities . Submission of Dissertation: The final approved dissertation must be submitted for publication by ProQuest via the UNH ETD Administrator website. Physical hard bound copies are available for purchase through Proquest at the time of submission. If the dissertation material is further published, it should be designated as having been accepted as a doctor

column3: The University of New Hampshire requires a minimum of three hours of student academic work each week. column2: What does an AU grade mean?
column3: An AU grade is assigned for completion of courses for which an audit was granted. No credit is earned. Grades: "IA" indicates "incomplete" in thesis credit, doctoral research, or other continuing courses of more than one semester.

column2: What does an IA grade indicate?
column3: IA grade indicates incomplete in thesis credit, doctoral research, or other continuing courses of more than one semester. The grade earned will replace the "IA" once the work has been completed and the final term of enrollment will be assigned a "CR".

column2: What is the policy on course withdrawal (W) and its impact?
column3: Students who submit an approved petition to drop a course during the withdrawal period will receive an AF grade, which is maintained on the official student record and included in the grade point average (GPA). Not attending classes does not constitute an automatic withdrawal.

column2: What happens when a graduate course is repeated?
column3: If the course numbers and/or titles do not match exactly, graduate students must obtain written permission of their adviser, graduated program coordinator, and the endorsement of the Graduate School dean before the adjustment will be made. A course may only be repeated once. Only repeated courses taken at UNH will alter the cumulative grade-­point average.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Repeated%20courses%3A%20Repeating%20a%20course%20does%20not%20remove%20the%20original%20course%20or%20grade%20from%20the%20record.)"]

column2: How many times per year are graduate degrees conferred at UNH?
column3: The University of New Hampshire (UNH) is a land-grant institution that prides itself on extensive research endeavors and the involvement of undergraduate students and graduate students in research projects.

column2: When is the annual commencement ceremony?
column3: Doctoral, Master's, Ed.S., and certificate students who earn their degrees in the preceding September and December are invited to participate in commencement ceremonies in May.

column2: How long do I have to complete my master’s degree?
column3: The four-year time limit must be completed within four years from the date of matriculation (enrollment following admission). Students failing to make adequate advancement toward completion of the program are subject to dismissal in advance.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Time Limit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20graduate%20work%20for%20any%20master%27s%20degree%20must%20normally%20be%20completed%20within%20four%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20following%20admission%29%20in%20the)"]

column2: How many thesis credits do I need to complete for my program?

column2: Can I defer my admission?
column3: Applicants who cannot enroll in the term for which admission was offered may request to have their admission deferred for up to one year. Such requests must be in writing and will be considered only once. Because enrollments are limited and competition for admission may vary from year to year, such requests may not be granted.

column2: Does UNH offer student health insurance?
column3: The University of New Hampshire (UNH) is a land-grant institution that is responsible for the ethical and safe conduct of research and scholarly activity. column2: Can I change my degree?
column3: Applicants who can not enroll in the term for which admission was offered may request to have their admission deferred for up to one year. Students who request a Deferral, and who are not currently active in another degree program, are responsible for dropping any courses they may be currently enrolled in at the time they request the Delugeral. Such requests must be in writing and will be considered only once. Because enrollments are limited and competition for admission may vary from year to year, such requests may not be granted.

column2: What must conditionally admitted graduate students do to remain in the Graduate School?
column3: The final oral examination is conducted by the doctoral committee and is intended to give the candidate an opportunity to defend the dissertation. column2: What is the policy on course withdrawal (W) and its impact?
column3: The specific withdrawal deadlines can be found on the UNH Academic Calendar. Failure to officially withdraw will result in an AF grade, which is maintained and included in the grade point average (GPA). Not attending classes does not constitute an automatic withdrawal.

column2: Can I transfer credits into my program?
column3: Graduate-level courses taken prior to admission may be transferred into the program and applied to the total only if they were not taken while matriculated in another degree program, as per Graduate School policy. Transfer credits must be formally approved and appear on the UNH transcript in order for them to count towards the degree requirements.

column2: How do I withdraw from the program?

column2: How many credits are required in the Core Curriculum for the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column2: What transferable professional skills are emphasized in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column2: According to the Cybersecurity Engineering (M.S.) description, what will students learn to develop and operate?
column3: Cybersecurity Engineering (M.S.): Designed for working professionals and those with a strong interest in cybersecurity, the program combines in-class and online learning on how to develop, engineer and operate secure information systems. You will learn the theoretical underpinnings of information security and have opportunities to apply your knowledge and skills to real-world scenarios and authentic project experiences.

column2: Can programs set stricter academic standards than the Graduate School?
column3: Academic Standards: Each individual program may set and announce standards for coursework, examinations, and/or research achievement that are more rigorous than the Graduate School standard.

column2: What is the deadline to appeal a dismissal decision?
column3: Generally, dismissed students will not be able to continue in classes pending the outcome of the appeal, but the program chairperson may make a final decision regarding whether to uphold or overturn the dismissal, normally within 20 days of receiving the appellate decision.
column4: ["- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=To%20appeal%20a%20dismissal%20decision%2C%20a%20student%20must%20submit%20a%20letter%20and%20any%20supporting%20documents%20to%20the%20program%20chairperson%20and%20the%20dean%20of%20the%20Graduate%20School)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=If%20the%20decision%20to%20dismiss%20stands%20after%20informal%20discussions%2C%20a%20student%20wishing%20to%20enter%20a%20formal%20appeal%20shall%20follow%20the%20procedure%20outlined%20below%20under)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Graduate%20Level%20Appeal%20%E2%80%93%20If%20the%20student%20is%20dissatisfied%20with%20the%20decision%20reached%20by%20the%20program%20chairperson%2C%20they%20may%20request%20that%20the%20dean%20of%20the%20Graduate)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Program%20Level%20Appeal%20%E2%80%93%20The%20program%20chairperson%20will%20review%20the%20appeal%2C%20solicit%20input%20from%20all%20other%20graduate%20faculty%20in%20the%20program%2C%20and%20re-evaluate%20the)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Policy and Procedure for Program Dismissals - Appeals Process (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/)"]

column2: How many graduate credits are required for a master’s degree at UNH?
column3: Credits: A minimum of 30 graduate credits is required for all master's degrees. Many programs require substantially more than the minimum 30 credits. Individual program requirements are outlined in the program descriptions of this catalog.

column2: What is the time limit to complete a master’s degree?

column2: What are the residency requirements for the Ph.D.?
column3: A minimum of three academic years of graduate study is required for the Ph.D degree. Resident graduate work done at other universities may be counted toward the minimum requirement upon approval of the guidance committee and the Graduate School, but one full academic year must be in residence at the University of New Hampshire.

column2: What is the minimum grade to receive graduate credit?
column3: Graduate credit is only granted for courses completed with a grade of B-­ or higher. Individual programs may have stricter requirements, and those are published with their degree program requirements.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20credit%20is%20only%20granted%20for%20courses%20completed%20with%20a%20grade%20of%20B-%C2%AD%20or%20higher.)"]

column2: Can graduate students take courses pass/fail?
column3: Graduate courses cannot be taken pass/fail.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20graduate%20student%20may%20petition%20to%20take%20undergraduate%20courses%20on%20a%20pass/fail%20basis.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Thus%2C%20students%20may%20be%20dismissed%20if%20they%20accumulate%20fewer%20than%209%20credits%20below%20the%20%22B%C2%AD-%22%20level%2C%20and/or%20fail%20to%20make%20adequate%20progress%20in%20other%20aspects%20of%20their)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Graduate%20students%20will%20have%20a%20maximum%20of%20two%20opportunities%20to%20successfully%20complete%20final%20examinations%20for%20the%20master%27s%20or%20Ed.S.)", "- Registration - Registration - Full/Part Time Status - Dropping and Adding Courses (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Graduate%20students%20may%20add%20or%20drop%20courses%20in%20accordance%20with%20the%20procedures%20and%20deadlines%20published%20by%20the%20Registrar%27s%20Office%20.)", "- Registration - Registration - Full/Part Time Status - Dropping and Adding Courses (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: What does an AF grade mean?
column3: An "AF" grade, Administrative F, is assigned for failure to either drop or complete a course.

column2: When is a CR grade used?
column3: Credit/Fail Grades: Given in specific courses having no letter grades, such as thesis/dissertation, as well as other approved courses or seminars.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20%22CR%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20successful%20completion%2C%20while%20an%20%22F%22%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure.)"]

column3: An AU grade is assigned for completion of courses for which an audit was granted.

column2: How does an Incomplete (IC) work for graduate courses?
column3: An incomplete grade is assigned with the approval of the instructor for excused unfinished work only.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20work%20must%20be%20completed%20and%20submitted%20to%20the%20instructor%20by%20the%20date%20agreed%20upon%20with%20the%20instructor%2C%20but%20not%20later%20than%20the%20last%20day%20of%20classes%20of%20the)"]

column2: What happens when a graduate course is repeated?

column2: How many times per year are graduate degrees conferred at UNH?
column3: Degree Conferral: Graduate degrees are conferred three times per year (September 1, December 31, and May (date varies) ).
column4: ["- Admissions - Admissions - Admission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Official%20offers%20of%20admission%20from%20the%20Graduate%20School%20are%20made%20for%20a%20specific%20term%20and%20year%20in%20one%20of%20the%20following%20categories%3A%20regular%20or%20conditional.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Degree Conferral (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=Graduate%20degrees%20are%20conferred%20three%20times%20per%20year%20%28September%201%2C%20December%2031%2C%20and%20May%20%28date%20varies%29%20%29.)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - Internal to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=A%20maximum%20of%2012%20credits%20of%20UNH%20graduate%20level%20%28800-900%29%20courses%20completed%20by%20a%20non-degree%20student%20or%20taken%20as%20an%20accelerated%20master%27s%20student%20may%2C%20upon)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Transfer%20credits%20must%20be%20formally%20approved%20and%20appear%20on%20the%20UNH%20transcript%20in%20order%20for%20them%20to%20count%20towards%20the%20degree%20requirements.)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - External to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Students%20may%20request%20that%20a%20maximum%20of%20two%20courses%2C%20for%20up%20to%208%20credits%20of%20graduate%20level%20coursework%2C%20from%20an%20accredited%20institution%20authorized%20to%20grant)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - External to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/)"]

column2: What must doctoral students do to participate in the May ceremony?
column3: Doctoral students must have completed all requirements for the degree by the published deadlines for May in order to participate in the May ceremony.
column4: ["- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=Doctoral%20students%20must%20have%20completed%20all%20requirements%20for%20the%20degree%20by%20the%20published%20deadlines%20for%20May%20in%20order%20to%20participate%20in%20the%20May%20ceremony.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=Doctoral%2C%20Master%27s%2C%20Ed.S.%2C%20and%20certificate%20students%20who%20earned%20their%20degrees%20in%20the%20preceding%20September%20and%20December%20are%20invited%20to%20participate%20in%20commencement)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=The%20annual%20commencement%20ceremony%20is%20held%20in%20May.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=All%20graduate%20students%20who%20intend%20to%20participate%20in%20the%20May%20ceremony%20must%20register%20to%20attend%20through%20the%20Commencement%20Office.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=students%20at%20candidacy%20must%20register%20for%20Doctoral%20Research%20%28999%29%20each%20semester%20during%20the%20academic%20year%20until%20the%20degree%20is%20awarded.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column3: Graduate students who intend to participate in the May ceremony must register to attend through the Commencement Office.

column2: Where can I find the intent-to-graduate deadlines?
column3: Students who do not file an intent-to-graduate will not have their degree awarded. More information on this process is available on the Graduate School’s website: http://www.gradschool.unh.edu. Application Deadlines: Application deadlines for admission and financial aid vary by program. These are updated on an annual basis and may be found on each of the program pages.

column2: What is the minimum passing grade for graduate students?
column3: Students may be dismissed if they accumulate fewer than 9 credits below the "B­-" level, and/or fail to make adequate progress in other aspects of their graduate program.
column4: ["- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Each%20individual%20program%20may%20set%20and%20announce%20standards%20for%20coursework%2C%20examinations%2C%20and/or%20research%20achievement%20that%20are%20more%20rigorous%20than%20the%20Graduate)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Courses%20at%20the%20700-%C2%ADlevel%20approved%20for%20graduate%20credit%20cannot%20be%20taken%20for%20pass/fail.)"]

column2: What is an IA grade?
column3: AF Grades: An "AF" grade, Administrative F, is assigned for failure to either drop or complete a course.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20grade%20earned%20will%20replace%20the%20%22IA%22%20once%20the%20work%20has%20been%20completed.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Audit%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AU%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20completion%20of%20courses%20for%20which%20an%20audit%20was%20granted.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=AF%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AF%22%20grade%2C%20Administrative%20F%2C%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure%20to%20either%20drop%20or%20complete%20a%20course.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20credit%20is%20only%20granted%20for%20courses%20completed%20with%20a%20grade%20of%20B-%C2%AD%20or%20higher.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: Can I take a course pass/fail?
column3: Graduate courses cannot be taken pass/fail.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20graduate%20student%20may%20petition%20to%20take%20undergraduate%20courses%20on%20a%20pass/fail%20basis.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Only%20courses%20completed%20with%20a%20grade%20of%20B-%20or%20higher%20may%20be%20used%20to%20fulfill%20certificate%20requirements.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Repeated%20courses%3A%20Repeating%20a%20course%20does%20not%20remove%20the%20original%20course%20or%20grade%20from%20the%20record.)"]

column2: Can I transfer credits into my program?
column3: Students may request that a maximum of two courses, for up to 8 credits of graduate level coursework, from an accredited institution authorized to grant graduate degrees, be transferred to count toward their graduate program.

column3: A graduate student may petition to take undergraduate courses on a pass/fail basis.

column2: Can I do a dual degree?
column3: Dual degrees: Concurrent Dual Degrees. Enrollment in concurrent dual degrees occurs when a student is admitted to and matriculated in two graduate degree programs at the University of New Hampshire simultaneously.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Dual%20degrees%20should%20be%20interpreted%20to%20include%20separate%20majors%20within%20the%20same%20degree%2C%20or%20a%20combination%20of%20two%20different%20degrees.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Integrated%20dual%20degree%20programs%20may%20include%20a%20single%20admissions%20process%2C%20submission%20of%20a%20single%20thesis%20or%20capstone%20experience%2C%20and%20a%20single%20advisory%20committee)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20standard%20policies%20relating%20to%20time%20to%20degree%2C%20residency%20requirements%2C%20academic%20standards%2C%20and%20minimum%20GPA%20required%20to%20graduate%20apply%20to%20any%20dual-%C2%ADdegree)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Enrollment%20in%20concurrent%20dual%20degrees%20occurs%20when%20a%20student%20is%20admitted%20to%20and%20matriculated%20in%20two%20graduate%20degree%20programs%20at%20the%20University%20of%20New%20Hampshire)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=If%20the%20student%20withdraws%20from%20one%20of%20the%20participating%20programs%2C%20the%20dual-degree%20arrangement%20is%20automatically%20nullified.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: Can I appeal a dismissal?
column3: The appeal should provide specific evidence, context, or mitigating factors that the student believes should be considered in reviewing the decision.

column2: How do I reach degree candidacy?
column3: Students are expected to file an Advancement to Candidacy form with the Graduate School as soon as possible after all of the requirements for candidacy have been met.
column4: ["- Admissions - Admissions - Applying for Admission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Persons%20holding%20a%20baccalaureate%20degree%20from%20an%20accredited%20college%20or%20university%20may%20apply%20for%20admission%20to%20the%20Graduate%20School.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=student%20is%20advanced%20to%20candidacy%20for%20the%20degree%20by%20the%20dean%20of%20the%20Graduate%20School%20upon%20recommendation%20of%20the%20graduate%20program%20coordinator%20after%20the%20student)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=%2ANote%3A%20If%20the%20doctoral%20candidacy%20form%20is%20received%20before%20the%20final%20day%20to%20register%20for%20the%20current%20semester%2C%20then%20candidacy%20shall%20be%20effective%20immediately.)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Level%203%20-%20-%20%2425%2C310%20%28Doctoral%20students%20at%20candidacy%29)", "- Registration - Registration - Continuous Registration Policy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Pre%C2%AD-candidacy%20doctoral%20students%20must%20enroll%2C%20as%20appropriate%2C%20for%20course%20credits%2C%20Doctoral%20Research%20%28999%29%2C%20or%20Continuing%20Enrollment%20%28%20GRAD%20800%20Continuing)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/)", "- Registration - Registration - Continuous Registration Policy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: How long do I have to complete my master’s degree?
column3: Doctoral Time Limits: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Time Limit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20graduate%20work%20for%20any%20master%27s%20degree%20must%20normally%20be%20completed%20within%20four%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20following%20admission%29%20in%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Doctoral Time Limits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=must%20be%20completed%20within%20eight%20years%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20after%20admission%29%20or%20within%20seven%20years%20if%20the%20student%20entered%20with%20a%20master%27s%20degree%20in%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Educational Specialist Degree (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Requirements%20for%20completion%20of%20the%20educational%20specialist%20degree%20%28Ed.S.%29%20are%20found%20under%20the%20program%20descriptions%20of%20the%20Department%20of%20Education.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20coursework%20for%20a%20certificate%20must%20be%20completed%20within%203%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%29%20in%20the%20program.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: Is there housing available?
column3: Babcock Hall offers single occupancy rooms, each of which includes a mini fridge for your personal use! column2: Does UNH offer student health insurance?
column3: University policy requires full-time degree students that are enrolled in at least one in-person course to have health insurance as a condition of enrollment. Some students have the option of waiving this requirement if they present proof of adequate coverage; alternatively, students can acquire an affordable health benefits plan sponsored by the University: the UNH Student Health Benefits Plan (SHBP).

column2: Do I need to register?
column3: All graduate students who intend to participate in the May ceremony must register to attend through the Commencement Office. Continuing Enrollment (GRAD 800) (Part-Time Status, 0 Credits): The cost for this registration is $200 . There are no additional fees. Registration in fall and/or spring is not required.

column2: How many credits can I take?
column3: A maximum of 12 credits taken by a student prior to matriculation (internal and external combined) can be applied to an degree program. Transfer credits must be formally approved and appear on the UNH transcript in order for them to count towards the degree requirements. Credits: A minimum of 30 graduate credits is required for all master's degrees. Many programs require substantially more than the minimum 30 credits. Individual program requirements are outlined in the program descriptions of this catalog. Graduate credits are earned in courses numbered 800 through 999. In rare cases graduate degree students may petition to earn graduate credit for up to 12

column2: What is full time status?
column3: Students who are full-time may be granted full­- or half-­tuition scholarships for the academic year or semester. These awards provide for waiver of tuition and are subject to the maintenance of a high scholastic record in the Graduate School.

column2: How do I withdraw from the program?
column3: A student may request to fully withdraw from their graduate degree program during any semester by obtaining a withdrawal form from the Graduate School website. Students who formally withdraw are required to apply for readmission if they subsequently desire to resume their academic program.

column2: What is the purpose of the Core Curriculum in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column2: What is the main goal of the Capstone Experience in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Specialization (e.g., protein biochemistry, genetic engineering, cell imaging and phenotyping) is the main goal of the Capstone Experience in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program.

column2: What does each credit in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program represent in academic work?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS program has a core foundation in the theory and wet-laboratory skills of cell and tissue biology and culturing; protein and immunologic methods and therapeutics; and the molecular biotechnology of nucleic acids.

column2: What is the relationship between core courses and elective courses in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Core Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column2: What is the overall purpose of the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) Accelerated Master’s Option?
column3: The Biotechnology industry in New England is currently expanding at a substantial rate (2018 Job Trends Forecast, MassBioEd Foundation) and graduates of the M.S. in Biotechnologie: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences program will be well-prepared for anticipated growth in jobs projected for the biotech R&D, medical testing laboratory, pharmaceutical and biotechnology manufacturing laboratory instrumentation, academic, and other sectors in new England in the coming years.

column2: What core knowledge areas will students master in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The MS Biotech:IBMS program has a core foundation in the theory and wet-laboratory skills of cell and tissue biology and culturing; protein and immunologic methods and therapeutics; and the molecular biotechnology of nucleic acids.

column2: What must conditionally admitted graduate students do to remain in the Graduate School?
column3: Students offered conditional admission must meet the specific requirements stated at the time of their admission to remain in the Graduate School. Degree Conferral: All degree requirements and coursework must be completed prior to the degree conferral date. Graduate students MUST have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in order to graduate.

column2: What is the deadline to appeal a dismissal decision?
column3: Generally, dismissed students will not be able to continue in classes pending the outcome of the appeal, but the program chairperson may make a final decision regarding whether to uphold or overturn the dismissal, normally within 20 days of receiving the appellate decision.

column3: All master’s degrees at UNH must include a capstone experience.

column2: What is the time limit to complete a master’s degree?
column3: All graduate work for any master's degree must normally be completed within four years from the date of matriculation (enrollment following admission) in the program.

column2: What are the residency requirements for the Ph.D.?
column3: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.

column2: What are the key rules for the Accelerated Master’s program?
column3: Students admitted to the accelerated master's program must attend an orientation/advising meeting to accept their offer of admission and maintain a grade­-point average of 3.20 throughout their senior year, complete their undergraduate degree as planned, and pass graduate courses taken for credit with  Bâ- or better (some programs have stricter requirements). If these conditions are not met, admission may be withdrawn.
column4: ["- Natural Resources and the Environment (M.S.) - Natural Resources and the Environment (M.S.) - Accelerated Master's Overview - Accelerated Master's Requirements (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/natural-resources/natural-resources-environment-ms/#:~:text=See%20the%20Accelerated%20Master%E2%80%99s%20Catalog%20Policy%20and%20Accelerated%20Master%E2%80%99s%20Website%20for%20additional%20information%20and%20a%20list%20of%20programs.)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Students%20admitted%20to%20the%20accelerated%20master%27s%20program%20must%20attend%20an%20orientation/advising%20meeting%20to%20accept%20their%20offer%20of%20admission%20and%20maintain%20a)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Each%20program%27s%20faculty%20retain%20discretion%20regarding%20whether%20their%20program%20admits%20students%20under%20the%20accelerated%20master%27s%20program%2C%20as%20well%20as%20the%20maximum%20number)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Accelerated%20Master%27s%20800-level%20credit%20forms%20must%20be%20completed%20and%20approved%20by%20the%20undergraduate%20advisor%20and%20program%20coordinator%20of%20the%20Graduate%20School%20at%20the)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/)"]

column3: Graduate credit is only granted for courses completed with a grade of B-­ or higher. Individual programs may have stricter requirements, and those are published with their degree program requirements.

column2: How does an Incomplete (IC) work for graduate courses?
column3: Students may be dismissed if they accumulate fewer than 9 credits below the "B­-" level, and/or fail to make adequate progress in other aspects of their graduate program.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20work%20must%20be%20completed%20and%20submitted%20to%20the%20instructor%20by%20the%20date%20agreed%20upon%20with%20the%20instructor%2C%20but%20not%20later%20than%20the%20last%20day%20of%20classes%20of%20the)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=IA%20Grades%3A%20%22IA%22%20indicates%20%22incomplete%22%20in%20thesis%20credit%2C%20doctoral%20research%2C%20or%20other%20continuing%20courses%20of%20more%20than%20one%20semester.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Courses%20at%20the%20700-%C2%ADlevel%20approved%20for%20graduate%20credit%20cannot%20be%20taken%20for%20pass/fail.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Each%20individual%20program%20may%20set%20and%20announce%20standards%20for%20coursework%2C%20examinations%2C%20and/or%20research%20achievement%20that%20are%20more%20rigorous%20than%20the%20Graduate)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Repeated%20courses%3A%20Repeating%20a%20course%20does%20not%20remove%20the%20original%20course%20or%20grade%20from%20the%20record.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: What does an IA grade indicate?
column3: "IA" indicates "incomplete" in thesis credit, doctoral research, or other continuing courses of more than one semester.

column2: What is the policy on course withdrawal (W) and its impact?

column2: How many times per year are graduate degrees conferred at UNH?

column2: Where can I find the intent-to-graduate deadlines?
column3: Students who do not file an intent-to-graduate will not have their degree awarded. More information on this process is available on the Graduate School’s website: http://www.gradschool.unh.edu . column2: Can I transfer credits into my program?
column3: Graduate-level courses taken prior to admission may be transferred into the program and applied to the total only if they were not taken while matriculated in another degree program, as per Graduate School policy. Transfer credits must be formally approved and appear on the UNH transcript in order for them to count towards the degree requirements.

column2: Can I do a dual degree?
column3: Dual degrees: Concurrent Dual Degrees. Enrollment in concurrent dual degrees occurs when a student is admitted to and matriculated in two graduate degree programs at the University of New Hampshire simultaneously.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Dual%20degrees%20should%20be%20interpreted%20to%20include%20separate%20majors%20within%20the%20same%20degree%2C%20or%20a%20combination%20of%20two%20different%20degrees.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Integrated%20dual%20degree%20programs%20may%20include%20a%20single%20admissions%20process%2C%20submission%20of%20a%20single%20thesis%20or%20capstone%20experience%2C%20and%20a%20single%20advisory%20committee)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20standard%20policies%20relating%20to%20time%20to%20degree%2C%20residency%20requirements%2C%20academic%20standards%2C%20and%20minimum%20GPA%20required%20to%20graduate%20apply%20to%20any%20dual-%C2%ADdegree)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Enrollment%20in%20concurrent%20dual%20degrees%20occurs%20when%20a%20student%20is%20admitted%20to%20and%20matriculated%20in%20two%20graduate%20degree%20programs%20at%20the%20University%20of%20New%20Hampshire)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=If%20the%20student%20withdraws%20from%20one%20of%20the%20participating%20programs%2C%20the%20dual-degree%20arrangement%20is%20automatically%20nullified.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: How long do I have to complete my master’s degree?
column3: Doctoral Time Limits: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.

column2: Do I need RCR training?
column3: UNH has embarked on a program on the responsible conduct of research and scholarly activity (RCR) to: Capstone Seminar: Prerequisite(s): RMP 800 with an minimum grade of B-. Neurology Lab: or equivalent required prior to taking this course.

column2: How do I withdraw from the program?
column3: A student may request to fully withdraw from their graduate degree program during any semester by obtaining a withdrawal form from the Graduate School website. Students who formally withdraw are required to apply for readmission if they subsequently desire to resume their academic program.

column2: What is the purpose of the Core Curriculum in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column2: What is the deadline to appeal a dismissal decision?
column3: Generally, dismissed students will not be able to continue in classes pending the outcome of the appeal, but the program chairperson may make a final decision regarding whether to uphold or overturn the dismissal, normally within 20 days of receiving the appellate decision.

column2: Is a capstone required for master’s programs?
column3: All master’s degrees at UNH must include a capstone experience.

column2: How many thesis credits are required for a master’s thesis and how are they graded?
column3: The exact number of thesis credits that are required for each degree will be determined by the faculty of the individual programs.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Thesis - Thesis Credit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Students%20are%20not%20eligible%20to%20receive%20credit%20for%20any%20more%20than%20the%20maximum%20number%20of%20thesis%20credits%20required%20by%20the%20degree%20and%20are%20expected%20to%20monitor%20their)"]

column2: What is the time limit to complete a master’s degree?
column3: Doctoral Time Limits: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Time Limit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Progress%20toward%20the%20degree%20will%20be%20carefully%20monitored%20by%20the%20advisor%20and%20the%20Graduate%20School%20to%20ensure%20that%20adequate%20advancement%20is%20made%20toward%20the%20completion)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Doctoral Time Limits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Years%20on%20leave%20do%20not%20count%20toward%20the%20time%20limit.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20coursework%20for%20a%20certificate%20must%20be%20completed%20within%203%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%29%20in%20the%20program.)"]

column2: What are the residency requirements for the Ph.D.?
column3: A minimum of three academic years of graduate study is required for the Ph.D degree. Resident graduate work done at other universities may be counted toward the minimum requirement upon approval of the guidance committee and the Graduate School, but one full academic year must be in residence at the University of New Hampshire.

column2: When is a Ph.D. student advanced to candidacy and what form is required?

column2: What are the key rules for the Accelerated Master’s program?
column3: Accelerated Master's programs offer qualified University of New Hampshire undergraduate students the opportunity to begin graduate coursework in select graduate programs while completing a bachelor’s degree.

column2: What is the minimum grade to receive graduate credit?
column3: Graduate credit is only granted for courses completed with a grade of B-­ or higher. Individual programs may have stricter requirements, and those are published with their degree program requirements.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20credit%20is%20only%20granted%20for%20courses%20completed%20with%20a%20grade%20of%20B-%C2%AD%20or%20higher.)"]

column2: Can graduate students take courses pass/fail?
column3: Graduate courses cannot be taken pass/fail.

column2: How does an Incomplete (IC) work for graduate courses?
column3: An incomplete grade is assigned with the approval of the instructor for excused unfinished work only.

column2: What happens when a graduate course is repeated?

column2: How many times per year are graduate degrees conferred at UNH?
column3: Degree Conferral: Graduate degrees are conferred three times per year (September 1, December 31, and May (date varies) ).

column2: What is an IA grade?
column3: AF Grades: An "AF" grade, Administrative F, is assigned for failure to either drop or complete a course.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20grade%20earned%20will%20replace%20the%20%22IA%22%20once%20the%20work%20has%20been%20completed.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Audit%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AU%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20completion%20of%20courses%20for%20which%20an%20audit%20was%20granted.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=AF%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AF%22%20grade%2C%20Administrative%20F%2C%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure%20to%20either%20drop%20or%20complete%20a%20course.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20credit%20is%20only%20granted%20for%20courses%20completed%20with%20a%20grade%20of%20B-%C2%AD%20or%20higher.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: Can I take a course pass/fail?
column3: Graduate courses cannot be taken pass/fail.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20graduate%20student%20may%20petition%20to%20take%20undergraduate%20courses%20on%20a%20pass/fail%20basis.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Only%20courses%20completed%20with%20a%20grade%20of%20B-%20or%20higher%20may%20be%20used%20to%20fulfill%20certificate%20requirements.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Repeated%20courses%3A%20Repeating%20a%20course%20does%20not%20remove%20the%20original%20course%20or%20grade%20from%20the%20record.)"]

column2: Can I transfer credits into my program?
column3: Students may request that a maximum of two courses, for up to 8 credits of graduate level coursework, from an accredited institution authorized to grant graduate degrees, be transferred to count toward their graduate program.

column2: Can I take undergraduate courses as a grad student?
column3: A graduate student may petition to take undergraduate courses on a pass/fail basis.

column2: Can I do a dual degree?
column3: Dual degrees: Concurrent Dual Degrees. Enrollment in concurrent dual degrees occurs when a student is admitted to and matriculated in two graduate degree programs at the University of New Hampshire simultaneously.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Dual%20degrees%20should%20be%20interpreted%20to%20include%20separate%20majors%20within%20the%20same%20degree%2C%20or%20a%20combination%20of%20two%20different%20degrees.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Integrated%20dual%20degree%20programs%20may%20include%20a%20single%20admissions%20process%2C%20submission%20of%20a%20single%20thesis%20or%20capstone%20experience%2C%20and%20a%20single%20advisory%20committee)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20standard%20policies%20relating%20to%20time%20to%20degree%2C%20residency%20requirements%2C%20academic%20standards%2C%20and%20minimum%20GPA%20required%20to%20graduate%20apply%20to%20any%20dual-%C2%ADdegree)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Enrollment%20in%20concurrent%20dual%20degrees%20occurs%20when%20a%20student%20is%20admitted%20to%20and%20matriculated%20in%20two%20graduate%20degree%20programs%20at%20the%20University%20of%20New%20Hampshire)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=If%20the%20student%20withdraws%20from%20one%20of%20the%20participating%20programs%2C%20the%20dual-degree%20arrangement%20is%20automatically%20nullified.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: Can I appeal a dismissal?
column3: The appeal should provide specific evidence, context, or mitigating factors that the student believes should be considered in reviewing the decision.

column2: How do I reach degree candidacy?
column3: Students are expected to file an Advancement to Candidacy form with the Graduate School as soon as possible after all of the requirements for candidacy have been met.
column4: ["- Admissions - Admissions - Applying for Admission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Persons%20holding%20a%20baccalaureate%20degree%20from%20an%20accredited%20college%20or%20university%20may%20apply%20for%20admission%20to%20the%20Graduate%20School.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=student%20is%20advanced%20to%20candidacy%20for%20the%20degree%20by%20the%20dean%20of%20the%20Graduate%20School%20upon%20recommendation%20of%20the%20graduate%20program%20coordinator%20after%20the%20student)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=%2ANote%3A%20If%20the%20doctoral%20candidacy%20form%20is%20received%20before%20the%20final%20day%20to%20register%20for%20the%20current%20semester%2C%20then%20candidacy%20shall%20be%20effective%20immediately.)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Level%203%20-%20-%20%2425%2C310%20%28Doctoral%20students%20at%20candidacy%29)", "- Registration - Registration - Continuous Registration Policy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Pre%C2%AD-candidacy%20doctoral%20students%20must%20enroll%2C%20as%20appropriate%2C%20for%20course%20credits%2C%20Doctoral%20Research%20%28999%29%2C%20or%20Continuing%20Enrollment%20%28%20GRAD%20800%20Continuing)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/)", "- Registration - Registration - Continuous Registration Policy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: How long do I have to complete my master’s degree?
column3: Doctoral Time Limits: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Time Limit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20graduate%20work%20for%20any%20master%27s%20degree%20must%20normally%20be%20completed%20within%20four%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20following%20admission%29%20in%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Doctoral Time Limits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=must%20be%20completed%20within%20eight%20years%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20after%20admission%29%20or%20within%20seven%20years%20if%20the%20student%20entered%20with%20a%20master%27s%20degree%20in%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Educational Specialist Degree (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Requirements%20for%20completion%20of%20the%20educational%20specialist%20degree%20%28Ed.S.%29%20are%20found%20under%20the%20program%20descriptions%20of%20the%20Department%20of%20Education.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20coursework%20for%20a%20certificate%20must%20be%20completed%20within%203%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%29%20in%20the%20program.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: What is the deadline to file an intent to graduate?
column3: Graduate students must have completed all requirements for the degree by the published deadlines for May in order to participate in the May ceremony.

column2: Does UNH offer student health insurance?
column3: University policy requires full-time degree students that are enrolled in at least one in-person course to have health insurance as a condition of enrollment. Some students have the option of waiving this requirement if they present proof of adequate coverage; alternatively, students can acquire an affordable health benefits plan sponsored by the University: the UNH Student Health Benefits Plan (SHBP).

column2: Do I need to register?
column3: All graduate students who intend to participate in the May ceremony must register to attend through the Commencement Office. Continuing Enrollment (GRAD 800) (Part-Time Status, 0 Credits): The cost for this registration is $200 . There are no additional fees. Registration in fall and/or spring is not required.

column2: How many credits can I take?
column3: A maximum of 12 credits taken by a student prior to matriculation (internal and external combined) can be applied to an degree program. Transfer credits must be formally approved and appear on the UNH transcript in order for them to count towards the degree requirements. Credits: A minimum of 30 graduate credits is required for all master's degrees. Many programs require substantially more than the minimum 30 credits. Individual program requirements are outlined in the program descriptions of this catalog. Graduate credits are earned in courses numbered 800 through 999. In rare cases graduate degree students may petition to earn graduate credit for up to 12

column2: What is full time status?
column3: Students who are full-time may be granted full­- or half-­tuition scholarships for the academic year or semester. These awards provide for waiver of tuition and are subject to the maintenance of a high scholastic record in the Graduate School.

column2: Can I take a leave of absence?
column3: The procedure for an approved leave of absence requires that students submit a request, available at the Graduate School's website, along with appropriate documentation, prior to the term for which the leave is requested.

column2: How do I withdraw from the program?
column3: A student may request to fully withdraw from their graduate degree program during any semester by obtaining a withdrawal form from the Graduate School website. Students who formally withdraw are required to apply for readmission if they subsequently desire to resume their academic program.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Failure%20to%20officially%20withdraw%20will%20result%20in%20an%20AF%20grade%2C%20which%20is%20maintained%20on%20the%20official%20student%20record%20and%20included%20in%20the%20grade%20point%20average%20%28GPA%29.)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Withdrawal (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=A%20student%20may%20request%20to%20fully%20withdraw%20from%20their%20graduate%20degree%20program%20during%20any%20semester%20by%20obtaining%20a%20withdrawal%20form%20from%20the%20Graduate%20School%20website.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=If%20the%20student%20withdraws%20from%20one%20of%20the%20participating%20programs%2C%20the%20dual-degree%20arrangement%20is%20automatically%20nullified.)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Readmission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Students%20who%20withdraw%2C%20who%20have%20their%20degree%20status%20discontinued%2C%20or%20whose%20time%20limit%20has%20expired%20and%20subsequently%20desire%20to%20resume%20their%20academic%20program%2C%20are)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Readmission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: How many total credits are required for the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.)?
column3: The M.S. in Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (MS Biotech:IBMS) program at the University of New Hampshire is a STEM-designated graduate degree program that offers its students innovative experiential learning opportunities and delivers an content-rich, skills-based, and highly versatile curriculum for individuals seeking to advance their careers in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, or biomanufacturing sectors.

column2: What is the purpose of the Core Curriculum in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column2: How many total program credits are composed of core, elective, and capstone work in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS program has a core foundation in the theory and wet-laboratory skills of cell and tissue biology and culturing; protein and immunologic methods and therapeutics; and the molecular biotechnology of nucleic acids.

column2: What is the relationship between core courses and elective courses in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Core Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.
