column2: What is the overall purpose of the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) Accelerated Master’s Option?
column3: The Biotechnology industry in New England is currently expanding at a substantial rate (2018 Job Trends Forecast, MassBioEd Foundation) and graduates of the M.S. in Biotechnologie: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences program will be well-prepared for anticipated growth in jobs projected for the biotech R&D, medical testing laboratory, pharmaceutical and biotechnology manufacturing laboratory instrumentation, academic, and other sectors in new England in the coming years.

column2: What core knowledge areas will students master in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The MS Biotech:IBMS program has a core foundation in the theory and wet-laboratory skills of cell and tissue biology and culturing; protein and immunologic methods and therapeutics; and the molecular biotechnology of nucleic acids.

column2: What must conditionally admitted graduate students do to remain in the Graduate School?
column3: Students offered conditional admission must meet the specific requirements stated at the time of their admission to remain in the Graduate School. Degree Conferral: All degree requirements and coursework must be completed prior to the degree conferral date. Graduate students MUST have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in order to graduate.

column2: Can programs set stricter academic standards than the Graduate School?
column3: Academic Standards: Each individual program may set and announce standards for coursework, examinations, and/or research achievement that are more rigorous than the Graduate School standard.

column2: What is the deadline to appeal a dismissal decision?
column3: Generally, dismissed students will not be able to continue in classes pending the outcome of the appeal, but the program chairperson may make a final decision regarding whether to uphold or overturn the dismissal, normally within 20 days of receiving the appellate decision.

column2: How many graduate credits are required for a master’s degree at UNH?
column3: Credits: A minimum of 30 graduate credits is required for all master's degrees. Many programs require substantially more than the minimum 30 credits. Individual program requirements are outlined in the program descriptions of this catalog.

column2: What is the time limit for degree completion limit to complete a master’s degree?

column2: What are the residency requirements for the Ph.D.?
column3: A minimum of three academic years of graduate study is required for the Ph.D degree. Resident graduate work done at other universities may be counted toward the minimum requirement upon approval of the guidance committee and the Graduate School, but one full academic year must be in residence at the University of New Hampshire.

column2: What are the key rules for the Accelerated Master’s program?
column3: Accelerated Master's programs offer qualified University of New Hampshire undergraduate students the opportunity to begin graduate coursework in select graduate programs while completing a bachelor’s degree.
column4: ["- Physics (M.S.) - Physics (M.S.) - Accelerated Master's Overview - Accelerated Master's Requirements (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/physics/physics-ms/#:~:text=See%20the%20Accelerated%20Master%E2%80%99s%20Catalog%20Policy%20and%20Accelerated%20Master%E2%80%99s%20Website%20for%20additional%20information%20and%20a%20list%20of%20programs.)", "- Physics (M.S.) - Physics (M.S.) - Accelerated Master's Overview (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/programs-study/physics/physics-ms/#:~:text=Accelerated%20Master%E2%80%99s%20programs%20offer%20qualified%20University%20of%20New%20Hampshire%20undergraduate%20students%20the%20opportunity%20to%20begin%20graduate%20coursework%20in%20select)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Students%20admitted%20to%20the%20accelerated%20master%27s%20program%20must%20attend%20an%20orientation/advising%20meeting%20to%20accept%20their%20offer%20of%20admission%20and%20maintain%20a)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Each%20program%27s%20faculty%20retain%20discretion%20regarding%20whether%20their%20program%20admits%20students%20under%20the%20accelerated%20master%27s%20program%2C%20as%20well%20as%20the%20maximum%20number)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Accelerated%20Master%27s%20800-level%20credit%20forms%20must%20be%20completed%20and%20approved%20by%20the%20undergraduate%20advisor%20and%20program%20coordinator%20of%20the%20Graduate%20School%20at%20the)", "- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/)"]

column2: What is the minimum grade to receive graduate credit?
column3: Graduate credit is only granted for courses completed with a grade of B-­ or higher. Individual programs may have stricter requirements, and those are published with their degree program requirements.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Graduate%20credit%20is%20only%20granted%20for%20courses%20completed%20with%20a%20grade%20of%20B-%C2%AD%20or%20higher.)"]

column2: Can graduate students take courses pass/fail?
column3: Graduate courses cannot be taken pass/fail.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20graduate%20student%20may%20petition%20to%20take%20undergraduate%20courses%20on%20a%20pass/fail%20basis.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Thus%2C%20students%20may%20be%20dismissed%20if%20they%20accumulate%20fewer%20than%209%20credits%20below%20the%20%22B%C2%AD-%22%20level%2C%20and/or%20fail%20to%20make%20adequate%20progress%20in%20other%20aspects%20of%20their)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Graduate%20students%20will%20have%20a%20maximum%20of%20two%20opportunities%20to%20successfully%20complete%20final%20examinations%20for%20the%20master%27s%20or%20Ed.S.)", "- Registration - Registration - Full/Part Time Status - Dropping and Adding Courses (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Graduate%20students%20may%20add%20or%20drop%20courses%20in%20accordance%20with%20the%20procedures%20and%20deadlines%20published%20by%20the%20Registrar%27s%20Office%20.)", "- Registration - Registration - Full/Part Time Status - Dropping and Adding Courses (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: What does an AF grade mean?
column3: An "AF" grade, Administrative F, is assigned for failure to either drop or complete a course.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=AF%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AF%22%20grade%2C%20Administrative%20F%2C%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure%20to%20either%20drop%20or%20complete%20a%20course.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Audit%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AU%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20completion%20of%20courses%20for%20which%20an%20audit%20was%20granted.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20%22CR%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20successful%20completion%2C%20while%20an%20%22F%22%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20grade%20earned%20will%20replace%20the%20%22IA%22%20once%20the%20work%20has%20been%20completed.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=NR%20Grades%3A%20%22NR%22%20indicates%20%22Not%20Resolved%3A%20pending%20academic%20integrity%20allegation%22.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/)"]

column2: When is a CR grade used?
column3: Credit/Fail Grades: Given in specific courses having no letter grades, such as thesis/dissertation, as well as other approved courses or seminars.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=A%20%22CR%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20successful%20completion%2C%20while%20an%20%22F%22%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure.)"]

column2: What does an AU grade mean?
column3: An AU grade is assigned for completion of courses for which an audit was granted.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Audit%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AU%22%20grade%20is%20assigned%20for%20completion%20of%20courses%20for%20which%20an%20audit%20was%20granted.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20grade%20earned%20will%20replace%20the%20%22IA%22%20once%20the%20work%20has%20been%20completed.)", "- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=AF%20Grades%3A%20An%20%22AF%22%20grade%2C%20Administrative%20F%2C%20is%20assigned%20for%20failure%20to%20either%20drop%20or%20complete%20a%20course.)"]

column2: How does an Incomplete (IC) work for graduate courses?
column3: An incomplete grade is assigned with the approval of the instructor for excused unfinished work only.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=The%20work%20must%20be%20completed%20and%20submitted%20to%20the%20instructor%20by%20the%20date%20agreed%20upon%20with%20the%20instructor%2C%20but%20not%20later%20than%20the%20last%20day%20of%20classes%20of%20the)"]

column2: What does an IA grade indicate?
column3: "IA" indicates "incomplete" in thesis credit, doctoral research, or other continuing courses of more than one semester.

column2: What is the policy on course withdrawal (W) and its impact?
column3: Students are notified by the Graduate School when this administrative action is taken and are required to apply for readmission or reinstatement if they subsequently desire to resume their academic program.

column2: What happens when a graduate course is repeated?
column3: Graduate students must obtain written permission of their adviser, graduate program coordinator, and the endorsement of the Graduate School dean before the adjustment will be made.

column2: How many times per year are graduate degrees conferred at UNH?
column3: Degree Conferral: Graduate degrees are conferred three times per year (September 1, December 31, and May (date varies) ).
column4: ["- Admissions - Admissions - Admission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Official%20offers%20of%20admission%20from%20the%20Graduate%20School%20are%20made%20for%20a%20specific%20term%20and%20year%20in%20one%20of%20the%20following%20categories%3A%20regular%20or%20conditional.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Degree Conferral (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=Graduate%20degrees%20are%20conferred%20three%20times%20per%20year%20%28September%201%2C%20December%2031%2C%20and%20May%20%28date%20varies%29%20%29.)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - Internal to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=A%20maximum%20of%2012%20credits%20of%20UNH%20graduate%20level%20%28800-900%29%20courses%20completed%20by%20a%20non-degree%20student%20or%20taken%20as%20an%20accelerated%20master%27s%20student%20may%2C%20upon)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Transfer%20credits%20must%20be%20formally%20approved%20and%20appear%20on%20the%20UNH%20transcript%20in%20order%20for%20them%20to%20count%20towards%20the%20degree%20requirements.)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - External to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=Students%20may%20request%20that%20a%20maximum%20of%20two%20courses%2C%20for%20up%20to%208%20credits%20of%20graduate%20level%20coursework%2C%20from%20an%20accredited%20institution%20authorized%20to%20grant)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - External to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/)"]

column2: Do I have to file an intent to graduate?
column3: Graduate students must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher in order to graduate.

column2: When is the annual commencement ceremony?
column3: Doctoral, Master's, Ed.S., and certificate students who earned their degrees in the preceding September and December are invited to participate in commencement ceremonies in May.

column2: Who can participate in the May commencement ceremony?
column3: Doctoral students who earned their degrees in the preceding September and December are invited to participate in commencement ceremonies in May.
column4: ["- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=The%20annual%20commencement%20ceremony%20is%20held%20in%20May.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=Master%27s%2C%20Ed.S.%2C%20and%20certificate%20students%20who%20expect%20to%20complete%20their%20degree%20program%20in%20May%2C%20as%20well%20as%20those%20who%20expect%20to%20complete%20their%20programs%20at%20the%20end)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=All%20graduate%20students%20who%20intend%20to%20participate%20in%20the%20May%20ceremony%20must%20register%20to%20attend%20through%20the%20Commencement%20Office.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=For%20more%20information%20on%20how%20to%20register%20for%20commencement%20please%20visit%20the%20UNH%20Commencement%20Website%20.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/#:~:text=Doctoral%20students%20must%20have%20completed%20all%20requirements%20for%20the%20degree%20by%20the%20published%20deadlines%20for%20May%20in%20order%20to%20participate%20in%20the%20May%20ceremony.)", "- Graduation - Graduation - Commencement (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/graduation/)"]

column2: What must doctoral students do to participate in the May ceremony?
column3: Doctoral students must have completed all requirements for the degree by the published deadlines for May in order to participate in the May ceremony.

column2: What is the minimum passing grade for graduate students?
column3: Students may be dismissed if they accumulate fewer than 9 credits below the "B­-" level, and/or fail to make adequate progress in other aspects of their graduate program.

column2: What is an IA grade?
column3: AF Grades: An "AF" grade, Administrative F, is assigned for failure to either drop or complete a course.

column2: Can I do a dual degree?
column3: Dual degrees: Concurrent Dual Degrees. Enrollment in concurrent dual degrees occurs when a student is admitted to and matriculated in two graduate degree programs at the University of New Hampshire simultaneously.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Dual%20degrees%20should%20be%20interpreted%20to%20include%20separate%20majors%20within%20the%20same%20degree%2C%20or%20a%20combination%20of%20two%20different%20degrees.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Integrated%20dual%20degree%20programs%20may%20include%20a%20single%20admissions%20process%2C%20submission%20of%20a%20single%20thesis%20or%20capstone%20experience%2C%20and%20a%20single%20advisory%20committee)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20standard%20policies%20relating%20to%20time%20to%20degree%2C%20residency%20requirements%2C%20academic%20standards%2C%20and%20minimum%20GPA%20required%20to%20graduate%20apply%20to%20any%20dual-%C2%ADdegree)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Enrollment%20in%20concurrent%20dual%20degrees%20occurs%20when%20a%20student%20is%20admitted%20to%20and%20matriculated%20in%20two%20graduate%20degree%20programs%20at%20the%20University%20of%20New%20Hampshire)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=If%20the%20student%20withdraws%20from%20one%20of%20the%20participating%20programs%2C%20the%20dual-degree%20arrangement%20is%20automatically%20nullified.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: Can I appeal a dismissal?
column3: The appeal should provide specific evidence, context, or mitigating factors that the student believes should be considered in reviewing the decision.

column2: How do I reach degree candidacy?
column3: Students are expected to file an Advancement to Candidacy form with the Graduate School as soon as possible after all of the requirements for candidacy have been met.
column4: ["- Admissions - Admissions - Applying for Admission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Persons%20holding%20a%20baccalaureate%20degree%20from%20an%20accredited%20college%20or%20university%20may%20apply%20for%20admission%20to%20the%20Graduate%20School.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=student%20is%20advanced%20to%20candidacy%20for%20the%20degree%20by%20the%20dean%20of%20the%20Graduate%20School%20upon%20recommendation%20of%20the%20graduate%20program%20coordinator%20after%20the%20student)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Ph.D. Candidacy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=%2ANote%3A%20If%20the%20doctoral%20candidacy%20form%20is%20received%20before%20the%20final%20day%20to%20register%20for%20the%20current%20semester%2C%20then%20candidacy%20shall%20be%20effective%20immediately.)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/#:~:text=Level%203%20-%20-%20%2425%2C310%20%28Doctoral%20students%20at%20candidacy%29)", "- Registration - Registration - Continuous Registration Policy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Pre%C2%AD-candidacy%20doctoral%20students%20must%20enroll%2C%20as%20appropriate%2C%20for%20course%20credits%2C%20Doctoral%20Research%20%28999%29%2C%20or%20Continuing%20Enrollment%20%28%20GRAD%20800%20Continuing)", "- Fees and Financial Support - Fees and Financial Support - Graduate Appointments 2025-2026 (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/fees-financial-support/)", "- Registration - Registration - Continuous Registration Policy (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: How long do I have to complete my master’s degree?
column3: Doctoral Time Limits: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Time Limit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20graduate%20work%20for%20any%20master%27s%20degree%20must%20normally%20be%20completed%20within%20four%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20following%20admission%29%20in%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Doctoral Time Limits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=must%20be%20completed%20within%20eight%20years%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20after%20admission%29%20or%20within%20seven%20years%20if%20the%20student%20entered%20with%20a%20master%27s%20degree%20in%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Educational Specialist Degree (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Requirements%20for%20completion%20of%20the%20educational%20specialist%20degree%20%28Ed.S.%29%20are%20found%20under%20the%20program%20descriptions%20of%20the%20Department%20of%20Education.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20coursework%20for%20a%20certificate%20must%20be%20completed%20within%203%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%29%20in%20the%20program.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: Do I need RCR training?
column3: UNH has embarked on a program on the responsible conduct of research and scholarly activity (RCR) to:

column2: Does UNH offer student health insurance?
column3: University policy requires full-time degree students that are enrolled in at least one in-person course to have health insurance as a condition of enrollment. Some students have the option of waiving this requirement if they present proof of adequate coverage; alternatively, students can acquire an affordable health benefits plan sponsored by the University: the UNH Student Health Benefits Plan (SHBP).

column2: Do I need to register?
column3: All graduate students who intend to participate in the May ceremony must register to attend through the Commencement Office. column2: How many credits can I take?
column3: A maximum of 12 credits taken by a student prior to matriculation (internal and external combined) can be applied to an degree program. Transfer credits must be formally approved and appear on the UNH transcript in order for them to count towards the degree requirements. Credits: A minimum of 30 graduate credits is required for all master's degrees. Many programs require substantially more than the minimum 30 credits. Individual program requirements are outlined in the program descriptions of this catalog. Graduate credits are earned in courses numbered 800 through 999. In rare cases graduate degree students may petition to earn graduate credit for up to 12

column2: How do I withdraw from the program?
column3: A student may request to fully withdraw from their graduate degree program during any semester by obtaining a withdrawal form from the Graduate School website. Students who formally withdraw are required to apply for readmission if they subsequently desire to resume their academic program.

column2: How many total credits are required for the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.)?
column3: The M.S. in Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (MS Biotech:IBMS) program at the University of New Hampshire is a STEM-designated graduate degree program that offers its students innovative experiential learning opportunities and delivers an content-rich, skills-based, and highly versatile curriculum for individuals seeking to advance their careers in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, or biomanufacturing sectors.

column2: What is the purpose of the Core Curriculum in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS program has a core foundation in the theory and wet-laboratory skills of cell and tissue biology and culturing; protein and immunologic methods and therapeutics; and the molecular biotechnology of nucleic acids.

column2: What is the relationship between core courses and elective courses in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Core Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column2: What is the overall purpose of the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) Accelerated Master’s Option?
column3: The Biotechnology industry in New England is currently expanding at a substantial rate (2018 Job Trends Forecast, MassBioEd Foundation) and graduates of the M.S. in Biotechnologie: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences program will be well-prepared for anticipated growth in jobs projected for the biotech R&D, medical testing laboratory, pharmaceutical and biotechnology manufacturing laboratory instrumentation, academic, and other sectors in new England in the coming years.

column2: What core knowledge areas will students master in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The MS Biotech:IBMS program has a core foundation in the theory and wet-laboratory skills of cell and tissue biology and culturing; protein and immunologic methods and therapeutics; and the molecular biotechnology of nucleic acids.

column2: What is the deadline to appeal a dismissal decision?
column3: Generally, dismissed students will not be able to continue in classes pending the outcome of the appeal, but the program chairperson may make a final decision regarding whether to uphold or overturn the dismissal, normally within 20 days of receiving the appellate decision.

column2: How many graduate credits are required for a master’s degree at UNH?
column3: Credits: A minimum of 30 graduate credits is required for all master's degrees. Many programs require substantially more than the minimum 30 credits. Individual program requirements are outlined in the program descriptions of this catalog.
column4: ["- Admissions - Admissions - Accelerated Master's Program (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/admissions/#:~:text=Seniors%20who%20have%20been%20admitted%20to%20an%20approved%20program%20under%20the%20accelerated%20master%27s%20program%20and%20have%20completed%2090%20undergraduate%20credits%20may%20register%20for%20a)", "- Credit Transfer - Credit Transfer - Internal to UNH (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/credit-transfer/#:~:text=A%20maximum%20of%2012%20credits%20of%20UNH%20graduate%20level%20%28800-900%29%20courses%20completed%20by%20a%20non-degree%20student%20or%20taken%20as%20an%20accelerated%20master%27s%20student%20may%2C%20upon)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Degree Requirements - Credits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=In%20rare%20cases%20graduate%20degree%20students%20may%20petition%20to%20earn%20graduate%20credit%20for%20up%20to%2012%20credits%20in%20700-%C2%ADlevel%20courses%2C%20provided%20the%20credits%20are%20taken%20in%20a)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Courses%20may%20be%20applied%20to%20only%20one%20certificate%20program%20but%20may%20also%20be%20applied%20to%20a%20master%E2%80%99s%20or%20doctoral%20degree%20program%20at%20UNH.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: Can 700-level courses count for graduate credit?
column3: 700 Level Courses: 700-level courses are advanced undergraduate courses.

column2: What is the time limit for degree completion limit to complete a master’s degree?
column3: Doctoral Time Limits: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.

column2: What are the residency requirements for the Ph.D.?
column3: A minimum of three academic years of graduate study is required for the Ph.D degree. Resident graduate work done at other universities may be counted toward the minimum requirement upon approval of the guidance committee and the Graduate School, but one full academic year must be in residence at the University of New Hampshire.

column2: What is the minimum grade to receive graduate credit?
column3: Graduate credit is only granted for courses completed with a grade of B-­ or higher. Individual programs may have stricter requirements, and those are published with their degree program requirements.

column3: Graduate courses cannot be taken pass/fail.

column2: How does an Incomplete (IC) work for graduate courses?
column3: An incomplete grade is assigned with the approval of the instructor for excused unfinished work only.

column2: What is the minimum passing grade for graduate students?
column3: Students may be dismissed if they accumulate fewer than 9 credits below the "B­-" level, and/or fail to make adequate progress in other aspects of their graduate program.

column2: Can I do a dual degree?
column3: Dual degrees: Concurrent Dual Degrees. Enrollment in concurrent dual degrees occurs when a student is admitted to and matriculated in two graduate degree programs at the University of New Hampshire simultaneously.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Dual%20degrees%20should%20be%20interpreted%20to%20include%20separate%20majors%20within%20the%20same%20degree%2C%20or%20a%20combination%20of%20two%20different%20degrees.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Integrated%20dual%20degree%20programs%20may%20include%20a%20single%20admissions%20process%2C%20submission%20of%20a%20single%20thesis%20or%20capstone%20experience%2C%20and%20a%20single%20advisory%20committee)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20standard%20policies%20relating%20to%20time%20to%20degree%2C%20residency%20requirements%2C%20academic%20standards%2C%20and%20minimum%20GPA%20required%20to%20graduate%20apply%20to%20any%20dual-%C2%ADdegree)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Enrollment%20in%20concurrent%20dual%20degrees%20occurs%20when%20a%20student%20is%20admitted%20to%20and%20matriculated%20in%20two%20graduate%20degree%20programs%20at%20the%20University%20of%20New%20Hampshire)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=If%20the%20student%20withdraws%20from%20one%20of%20the%20participating%20programs%2C%20the%20dual-degree%20arrangement%20is%20automatically%20nullified.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: How do I reach degree candidacy?

column2: How long do I have to complete my master’s degree?
column3: Doctoral Time Limits: The Ph.D. must be completed within eight years of matriculation (enrollment after admission) or within seven years if the student entered with a master's degree in the same field.
column4: ["- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Master's Time Limit (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20graduate%20work%20for%20any%20master%27s%20degree%20must%20normally%20be%20completed%20within%20four%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20following%20admission%29%20in%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Doctoral Time Limits (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=must%20be%20completed%20within%20eight%20years%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%20after%20admission%29%20or%20within%20seven%20years%20if%20the%20student%20entered%20with%20a%20master%27s%20degree%20in%20the)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Educational Specialist Degree (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=Requirements%20for%20completion%20of%20the%20educational%20specialist%20degree%20%28Ed.S.%29%20are%20found%20under%20the%20program%20descriptions%20of%20the%20Department%20of%20Education.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=All%20coursework%20for%20a%20certificate%20must%20be%20completed%20within%203%20years%20from%20the%20date%20of%20matriculation%20%28enrollment%29%20in%20the%20program.)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Certificate Programs - CERTIFICATE TIME LIMIT (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)"]

column2: What is the Accelerated master's program program?

column2: Does UNH offer student health insurance?
column3: University policy requires full-time degree students that are enrolled in at least one in-person course to have health insurance as a condition of enrollment. Some students have the option of waiving this requirement if they present proof of adequate coverage; alternatively, students can acquire an affordable health benefits plan sponsored by the University: the UNH Student Health Benefits Plan (SHBP).

column2: What is the full time limit for degree completion status?

column2: Can I take a leave of absence?
column3: The procedure for an approved leave of absence requires that students submit a request, available at the Graduate School's website, along with appropriate documentation, prior to the term for which the leave is requested.

column2: How do I withdraw from the program?
column3: A student may request to fully withdraw from their graduate degree program during any semester by obtaining a withdrawal form from the Graduate School website. Students who formally withdraw are required to apply for readmission if they subsequently desire to resume their academic program.
column4: ["- Graduate Grading - Graduate Grading - Grades (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/grading/#:~:text=Failure%20to%20officially%20withdraw%20will%20result%20in%20an%20AF%20grade%2C%20which%20is%20maintained%20on%20the%20official%20student%20record%20and%20included%20in%20the%20grade%20point%20average%20%28GPA%29.)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Withdrawal (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=A%20student%20may%20request%20to%20fully%20withdraw%20from%20their%20graduate%20degree%20program%20during%20any%20semester%20by%20obtaining%20a%20withdrawal%20form%20from%20the%20Graduate%20School%20website.)", "- Academic Standards - Academic Standards (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/academic-standards/#:~:text=Policy%20and%20Procedure%20for%20Program%20Dismissals)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/#:~:text=If%20the%20student%20withdraws%20from%20one%20of%20the%20participating%20programs%2C%20the%20dual-degree%20arrangement%20is%20automatically%20nullified.)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Readmission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/#:~:text=Students%20who%20withdraw%2C%20who%20have%20their%20degree%20status%20discontinued%2C%20or%20whose%20time%20limit%20has%20expired%20and%20subsequently%20desire%20to%20resume%20their%20academic%20program%2C%20are)", "- Degree Requirements - Degree Requirements - Dual Degrees (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/academic-regulations-degree-requirements/degree-requirements/)", "- Registration - Registration - Non-registration - Readmission (https://catalog.unh.edu/graduate/general-information/registration/)"]

column2: How many total credits are required for the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.)?
column3: The M.S. in Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (MS Biotech:IBMS) program at the University of New Hampshire is a STEM-designated graduate degree program that offers its students innovative experiential learning opportunities and delivers an content-rich, skills-based, and highly versatile curriculum for individuals seeking to advance their careers in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, or biomanufacturing sectors.

column2: What is the purpose of the Core Curriculum in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. This provides you with important industry-relevant transferrable job skills, such as clear communication, cooperation and relationship building, teamwork and conflict resolution, and creative problem-solving and strategic thinking.

column2: What is the relationship between core courses and elective courses in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.): Core Curriculum The MS Biotech:IBMS core curriculum is centered around research project team-based lab courses. column2: What is the Accelerated Master’s Option in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The M.S. in Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (MS Biotech:IBMS) program at the University of New Hampshire is a STEM-designated graduate degree program that offers its students innovative experiential learning opportunities

column2: What is the overall purpose of the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) Accelerated Master’s Option?
column3: The Biotechnology industry in New England is currently expanding at a substantial rate (2018 Job Trends Forecast, MassBioEd Foundation) and graduates of the M.S. in Biotechnologie: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences program will be well-prepared for anticipated growth in jobs projected for the biotech R&D, medical testing laboratory, pharmaceutical and biotechnology manufacturing laboratory instrumentation, academic, and other sectors in new England in the coming years.

column2: What core knowledge areas will students master in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The MS Biotech:IBMS program has a core foundation in the theory and wet-laboratory skills of cell and tissue biology and culturing; protein and immunologic methods and therapeutics; and the molecular biotechnology of nucleic acids.

column3: Cybersecurity Engineering (M.S.): Designed for working professionals and those with a strong interest in cybersecurity, the program combines in-class and online learning on how to develop, engineer and operate secure information systems. column2: What kind of theoretical knowledge is paired with practice in the Cybersecurity Engineering (M.S.)?
column3: Cybersecurity Engineering (M.S.): Designed for working professionals and those with a strong interest in cybersecurity, the program combines in-class and online learning on how to develop, engineer and operate secure information systems. You will learn the theoretical underpinnings of information security and have opportunities to apply your knowledge and skills to real-world scenarios and authentic project experiences.

column2: How many graduate credits are required for a master’s degree at UNH?
column3: A minimum of 30 graduate credits is required for all master’s degrees. Many programs require substantially more than the minimum 30 credits. Individual program requirements are outlined in the program descriptions of this catalog. Graduate credits are earned in courses numbered 800-­999. In rare cases graduate degree students may petition to earn graduate credit for up to 12 credits in 700-­level courses, provided the credits were taken in a program other than that in which the student is seeking the degree and provided such courses are approved by the Student's adviser, graduate program coordinator, and the dean of the Graduate School. Such courses must be taken for

column2: How does an Incomplete (IC) work for graduate courses?
column3: An IC is allowed for excused unfinished work with instructor approval; work must be completed by the agreed date, no later than the last day of classes in the next semester for 800/900-level courses (earlier mid-semester deadline for 400–700). Extensions require a petition and usually do not exceed one year.

column2: Can I do a dual degree?
column3: Integrated dual degree programs can be applied to both programs. Students applying to the dual-degree programs must meet the application requirements for both the Departments of Social Work and Recreation Administration and Policy or the UNH School of Law. The number of required credit hours for integrated dual degrees must not be less than 80 percent of the total minimum hours required to complete each degree separately.

column2: How do I reach degree candidacy?
column3: During the fourth year of the program, students typically begin dissertation research and teach an introductory course in their specialty area. Most students complete the Ph.D. degree in the fifth year. Degree Requirements: Candidates for the degree must meet admission requirements, develop and complete an approved program of study in consultation with their guidance committee, complete required coursework, undergo an annual assessment review by the Doctoral Advisory Committee, development and submit a passing qualifying paper to advance to candidacy, write and present the dissertation, and pass the final oral examination.

column2: What is full time status?
column3: The full-time status of a Master's student is the same as the minimum of 6 credits and must be registered for 9 or more credits. The grade for each course is awarded upon completion of the entire two semester internship experience. Scholarships for Full-­Time Students: Students who are full­- time may be granted full–- or half--tuition scholarships for the academic year or semester. These awards provide for waiver of tuition and are subject to the maintenance of high scholastic record in the Graduate School.

column2: What core knowledge areas will students master in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: The MS Biotech:IBMS program has a core foundation in the theory and wet-laboratory skills of cell and tissue biology and culturing; protein and immunologic methods and therapeutics; and the molecular biotechnology of nucleic acids.

column2: What legal and regulatory understanding is expected in the Biotechnology: Industrial and Biomedical Sciences (M.S.) program?
column3: Biotechnology focuses on the application of the biological and biochemical sciences and particularly genetics to the preparation of new and enhanced biomedical, industrial, agricultural, and environmental products. Graduate instruction in this area would include molecular biology, cell and tissue culturing, protein biological development, bioinformatics, functional and comparative genomics.

column3: Students will be able to demonstrate the ability to function as a member and leader of the team. column2: Where is the Cybersecurity Engineering (M.S.) program offered?
column3: The M.S. in Cybersecurity Engineering gives you the technical skills and experience to meet that demand, preparing you to secure information, communications, networks and control systems for any organization. Key Points: Designed for working professionals and those with a strong interest in cybersecurity, the program combines in-class and online learning on how to develop, engineer and operate security information systems. You will learn the theoretical underpinnings of information security and have opportunities to apply your knowledge and skills to real-world scenarios and authentic project experiences.
